annotation.TEXT: Alright, it's castle time! Anything hidden in the upper-left here? Probably not, but you never know...
Huh. Okay, so I can go up to or come down from the ceiling here. Also, there's another oddly placed springboard, which it looks like I'll have to use if I stick to the low road.
Well, at least this means I'm not necessarily forced to lose my power up now.
Now how was I supposed to deal with that surprise fish?! I doubt I could've dodged it even if I knew it was coming!
Demo count: 2
Nice!
That'll do. Also, yeah, yeah... I know I'm wasting time. Now, exit here, then hold right while going Turbo with A!

Thwack! Just be careful if you slay a Podoboo like this, because a new one will eventually pop up anyway. (In fact, sometimes, it'll pop up before the killed one falls off the screen, so pay attention for that!)

And we're back to bullets. (I wonder if it's possible for a bullet to go freaky like that flame did earlier. But, at least if that were to happen, I could still stomp it by making sure I'm in the air and descending at the point we collide.)
LOL, wall clipping glitch. (Tap left with the right timing while on a moving platform like this to get pulled through solid objects.)
Nuts. Scrolled a little too far. Once the flower completely disappears from view, you can't get it.
Alright, so for 2-3, it's suddenly nighttime, and the mushroom platforms are white.
Let's find an exit pipe from here leading down...
Aw, nuts. Looks like I won't get to check a couple of the ? blocks in the middle of this row. They were all probably just coins, though.
Hmm... I'm thinking this was meant to be a sky bonus area (possibly for the vine that was coming up later), but the room type is wrong for that (so falling into a pit here would kill me).
Oh, brother. I know what's gonna happen here! GERONIMO!!!
Gotta check for hidden blocks... Let me know if I miss any hidden blocks in 2-3, since I'll probably be repeating this level in 7-3 (assuming this hack goes that far).
Oh, this place looks familiar (which makes sense, since 1-1 and 2-1 share the same pipe bonus room in the original SMB). I'll just save everyone some time and take the first exit here.
So, once again, I could've cleared this castle through a flagpole instead. (Oh, and I'll probably show off what happens if you do clear a castle with a flagpole later on.)
What the french toast?!

Nuts, and I didn't have invincibility to deal with the freaky flame this time. Oh, also, those ground blocks up there are breakable if you're big, but if you hit them while you're small, they appear to become a brown used block, though you can still hit them again and again.
However, I probably will come back and show the entirety of 2-2 at a later date. (But I better make sure I enter it big and not die!)
Oh, man. Another power up, but I wonder if I can reach it...
Oh, man. Time's running out... again. I'm not gonna bother trying to check the brick columns here.
Alright, now I'm still going to stay down here, because I don't want to skip the whole level, and I want to prove that I can make these tricky jumps.
That was weird. I wonder why that Spiny ignored my first shot... Well, whatever. Let's just torch Bowser and then check this brick here.
Going down, and I end up... here... Well, that's strange...
Alright, mushrooms make non-fatal brain damage go away, just like in real life! (Not really.)
Alright, three perfect flagpole/fireworks hits in a row today!
Well, that's a strange place to emerge. (I bet I could go through the wall on the left upon emerging if I really tried.)
Same place as last time. Alright, let's try going all the way to the end this time to see if I end up anywhere different.
Let's try this again, although I have no idea how I'm supposed to dodge that freaky flame... Maybe it's intended as a power up filter here.
Yep, it's a 1-up. But is there anything in this brick column?
Huh. I wonder why sometimes the bullet generator fires two bullets in quick succession like that. (I've seen that occasionally happen near the end of 5-3 in the original game as well.)
Oh, I recognize this place. Well, normally I'd back up to show more of the level, but that first fish would probably screw me over no matter what, so I'm gonna just say "Screw you!" to this level!
Hello, and welcome back to New Strange Mario Bros.! I bet this level looks familiar to you guys (assuming you watched episode 0)!
And we have yet another 1-up. I was expecting a multi-coin block in this case.
Nuts. My greed for coins kept me from wanting to check that pipe (but checking back later, it leads to the same place that the pipe at the end of this area leads to).
Let's see if I can successfully get the second power up here this time...
Let's try that again, shall we? (At least I've still got 19 lives remaining!)
Gah! Stupid flame appearing in the worst spot at the worst time!
Nope. I wasn't expecting anything in that column anyway.
No wonky speed to make me slip and fall here this time!
Yah! Maybe I should've gone along the ceiling...
Whoa! Don't rush forward too fast, now!
Yo, heard. I bullets you like dude...
Wow, it's like bullet-ception here.
Ha! That's showing the bullet how strong the back of your head is, Mario!
Huh. I bet that brick sticking out on the bottom has something.
Huh? No freaky flame this time? Hmm... I wonder if the freaky flame has anything to do with the Bullet Bill generator being just before the flame generator...
Oh, man. Bowser fire (and fortunately not freaky fire). Maybe I'm getting close to the end...

That was a lucky bullet stomp right there (Bullet Bills are one of the few foes in this game that allow you to stomp them while you're ascending, as long as your feet are hitting the upper part of them). Also, I could go along the ceiling here, but... nah.
Oh, I recognize these three bricks. Hit them one at a time if you want to collect their contents.
Now, let's see what 2-2 is like. It's probably different from 0-2, though it'll likely still be a water level.
Alright. Now, I could ride the elevator through the ceiling, but I'm still going to remain down here.
Demo count: 3
Yeah, so apparently the world 0 version of this hack used this level's data for 0-1. However, I betcha the pipes won't just reset the level this time around!
Fake Kaizo trap count: 3
Alright, I'm outta here. Yes, I ended up skipping part of the level, but what I skipped was already entirely shown in episode 0, so it's no big deal.
Well, I came out on the same screen, but without the emerging motion, and further down and to the left. Okay, now I want to try something...
Yes! As long as part of the flower is still visible, it can still be grabbed. (Good thing I know how to do that little wall jump trick there!)

"A" is for "Awesome"! (Also it means I have 20 lives right now.) So, next time, I'll be playing world 3! (Ooh, nice timing on the pause button there, before Mario could become visible!) To be continued...
Oh, and I'll properly collect all three of the 1-ups here this time.

Hmm... For this row of ? blocks, I'll want to grab the coins on top first, because like I explained in the past, if a coin is resting on a block with anything in it, the block's contents will basically be negated if it's hit before grabbing the coin first.
GAAAMMMEEE!!!
Obviously, try not to get roasted, or I won't be able to break all the bricks.

Oh, yeah. You can also make a vine disappear by hitting another item block, but interestingly, whatever was there of the vine will actually still be climbable, even though it's no longer visible (and if it's high enough, you can still climb off the top of the screen too).
Alright, let's quickly finish the level before the timer makes Mario suddenly suffer a fatal heart attack.
Whoops! Even revealing a vine will cause a different item to vanish. Also, this vine actually does not go high enough for Mario to climb off the top of the screen with.
Aha! Now I'm over here and can go down this pipe! But, it's meaningless, as it just leads to the same place once again.
